description.narrative: :Children and women of reproductive age receive all vaccines under National EPI programme, achieving and sustaining high immunization coverage at national and district levels,which contributes to Child Health, Early Childhood Development, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable use of high-impact maternal, newborn, child health and nutrition specific and sensitive interventions.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: :Children and women of reproductive age receive all vaccines under National EPI programme, achieving and sustaining high immunization coverage at national and district levels

description.narrative:
Children and women were reached with quality immunization services through strong support to improved cold chain and vaccine management system. In 2019, there was also no vaccine stock out and cold chain breakdown reported.
| Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of targeted children (girls and boys)who are vaccinated with first dose of measles-containing vaccine (MR)
Percentage of cold chain equipment having electronic continous temperature monitoring system
Children 0-59 months vaccinated with polio through a UNICEF-supported programme during campaigns
Drop out rate between DPT1 and DPT3 coverage
